# Setting Advanced Chat Permissions

## How Superadmins can configure settings to control who can view conversations, send messages, and create channels.

### Manage Channels Settings

Navigate to Settings > Chat. This section provides an overview of all channels within the organization, including those that you may not be a member of.

![Screenshot 2024-07-02 at 9.52.18 AM](https://8332146.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hub/8332146/hubfs/Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%209.52.18%20AM.png?width=645&height=167&name=Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%209.52.18%20AM.png)

![Screenshot 2024-07-02 at 9.53.30 AM](https://8332146.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hub/8332146/hubfs/Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%209.53.30%20AM.png?width=648&height=340&name=Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%209.53.30%20AM.png)

### For each channel, the SuperAdmin is given 3 options:

#### 1 - Edit 'About' tab

This tab is available for all channels.

- _Channel name_: Edit channel name
- _Checkbox for auto-adding everyone in the org\*:_ Enabling this ensures all future members (new hires) are automatically added to this channel.

This option is only accessible for non-default channels that you are a part of. For definitions, refer to the blue box below.

![Screenshot 2024-07-02 at 12.01.14 PM](https://8332146.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hub/8332146/hubfs/Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%2012.01.14%20PM.png?width=522&height=298&name=Screenshot%202024-07-02%20at%2012.01.14%20PM.png)

#### 2 - Edit members of the channel

- This tab is only enabled for non-default channels that the you are a part of.
- This tab is disabled if channel is a default channel, or, if you are not a part of the channel.

**Definitions:**

**_Non-default_ :** Channels that are custom created

_**Default:**_ Channels that came pre-shipped (“everyone”, “inner circle”, “all owners”, “random”, “announcements”, and the location channels).

**_You are a part of_**: The logged in user is one of the participants of the channel. Doesn’t matter if the channel was created by you or someone else.

**Here you can add:**

- individual members

- groups of members that you want to be auto-added to this channel. The listed groups can be any role, job, or location.


#### 3 - Edit permission settings of the channel

_This is available for all channels._

1. **Who can invite/remove members**

_Superadmins in the channel can do this by default._
1. all channel members: everyone in the channel is allowed to invite or remove anyone else

2. creator of the channel ( + superadmins): this is default

3. specific members or roles: you cannot exclude superadmins. Any chosen members or roles, as long as they are participants of the channel, will be able to invite / remove anyone else.
2. **Who can post**

_Superadmins in the channel can do this by default._
1. all channel members: everyone in the channel is allowed to post

2. specific members or roles: you cannot exclude superadmins. Any chosen members or roles, as long as they are participants of the channel, will be able to post.
3. **Do not allow members to leave this channel**

4. **Delete channel for everyone**


Screen Recording 2024-07-02 at 9.55.15 AM \| HubSpot Video

![Screen Recording 2024-07-02 at 9.55.15 AM](https://8332146.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hub/8332146/hubfs/custom-video-thumbnails/Screen%20Recording%202024-07-02%20at%209.55.15%20AM-thumb.jpeg?length=1920)

### Restrict Chat Settings

**If toggle is ON**

- Chat feature will only be available to HQ team (superadmins and admins). Chat feature will be hidden entirely for LOs, Ws, and Ls.

**If toggle is OFF**

Chat feature is available to everyone.

- **Who can create new channels?**
  - Select via role or job. Whatever you do, you cannot exclude superadmins.
- **Who can start DMs?**
  - Select via role or job. Whatever you do, you cannot exclude superadmins.

###### Was this article helpful?    YesNo
